text.p: French President Jacques Chirac sent a get-well-soon message to Boris Yeltsin on Tuesday and got a telephone update on the Russian President's heart surgery from Russian Prime Minister Victor Chernomyrdin.
In a message addressed to "Mr President, Dear Boris", Chirac said: "I was very pleased to learn that your operation took place in the best conditions".

"I send you my warmest wishes for a quick recovery and hope you have a very good convalescence," Chirac said in the message, released by his office. He said he hoped to have "the pleasure" of talking to Yeltsin soon.

Chirac's office said Chernomyrdin, acting head of state in Yeltsin's absence, called Chirac to brief him on Yeltsin's multiple bypass operation. The Kremlin said the seven-hour surgery was successful.

"Mr Chernomyrdin gave the president good news about the health of Mr Yeltsin," a French official said. "The president said he was very happy to see that Mr Yeltsin had overcome his medical difficulties."

Chirac asked Chernomyrdin "to pass on his most friendly greetings to President Yeltsin and also asked him to pass on his warmest congratulations to all members of the medical team," the French official said.
Chirac and Chernomyrdin are due to meet on November 26 in Paris.
